overview:
Mr. Bolin formed EnerTech in 1992 with Norman Dickinson, the inventor of the SlurryCarbâ„¢ process, and Peter Dickinson, the company’s primary initial investor. Starting with seed capital of $25,000, Mr. Bolin was responsible for leading EnerTech through the start-up phase to its present status.

Mr. Bolin assembled the current EnerTech team. With this team, Mr. Bolin located significant corporate partners, successfully negotiated numerous license agreements and joint venture contracts, and raised sufficient capital to support operations and perform significant R&D work, including a Process Development Unit and the first EnerTech installation, a 20 ton per day unit in Japan. In 2007 alone, Mr. Bolin and the EnerTech team raised over $200 million to build EnerTech’s first commercial facility in Rialto, California and support the company’s growth.

In 2008, Engineering News Record Magazine recognized Mr. Bolin as an innovator in the industry by naming him one of ENR’s Top 25 Newsmakers for 2008.

Mr. Bolin has a Bachelor of Business Administration degree in Accountancy from the University of Notre Dame and is a Certified Public Accountant in New York and Georgia. He is a frequent speaker at emerging international growth company seminars.
